definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: Each vision reminded me that I was probably going to die.
sentences.chinese: 每个幻象使我想起，我可能要魂归地府了。
林发现自己已经身在地府了。

sentences.english: We offer food and wine to the famished ghosts that come up to earth from hell.
sentences.chinese: 我们供食物和酒给那些从地府来到人间的饿鬼。

sentences.english: Just at that moment, Hermes arrived in the underworld.
sentences.chinese: 就在此刻，赫耳墨斯到达地府。

sentences.english: It is said that people will be sent to hell after death.
sentences.chinese: 传说中，人死后是要被送到阴曹地府的。

sentences.english: After Ghost Month, ghosts have to return to the underworld, and the Gates of Hell close.
sentences.chinese: 鬼月过了，鬼将回到阴曹地府，鬼门也会关上。

sentences.english: You have no idea of the tortures I am sentenced to undergo in Hell.
sentences.chinese: 你们不知道我在地府里遭受的折磨。

definition: Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
Two deities, one short, one tall, chained together at the ankle, responsible for rewarding the good and punishing the bad
the Yellow Springs/the underworld of Chinese mythology/the equivalent of Hades or Hell
lower bound (math.)/world of mortals/(of Gods) to descend to the world of mortals
old variant of 豐都|丰都[Feng1 du1]/Fengdu county Chongqing municipality/name of a famous necropolis
